page.title: 15Ecology and the Environment
page.content: To the N.E.of Kidsgrove our area is on the very edge of the Pennine foothills and underlain by Productive Coal Measure beds except for an outcrop of Millstone Grit at Mount Pleasant ending the Mow Cop ridge.Farming is mainly restricted to grazing land due to the poor soil and undulating land which is cut by numerous small streams in quite deep valleys,making it easy to mine the coal at or near the surface,using opencast and footrail methods in addition to deep mining.Many shafts and derelict areas are to be found including a large pit bank N.W.of Brindley Ford.Settlements arising from mining dominate the area.Firstly as ribbon development along the lanes,and then miners estates.As mining declines recent building arises from movement out of the Potteries.
